page.title: 10THE CHURCH
page.content: This church was, in the main, built in 1863 by T.H.Wyatt. The only portions of the ancient church now remainig are the Early English window to the West ot the porch,the base of the tower,the piscina in the transcept, ant the small locker containig the sacered vessels which is also in the transcept but concealed by a wall. The church was rebuilt on the old foundations, except in the aisles, which is a later addition.The old chancel was unsually small. Incorporated into the wall were three stones which appeared to be sills of an Early English window.The transcept, now rebuilt in the Early English style, was a 14th century addition. Before rebuilding the nave had been enlarged.
